text: Brüggemann S (2023). pkgpins: Facilitates Results Caching R Packages Using Pins Package. https://pkgpins.rpkg.dev, https://gitlab.com/salim_b/r/pkgs/pkgpins.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pkgpins: Facilitates Results Caching in R Packages Using the Pins Package},   author = {Salim Brüggemann},   year = {2023},   note = {https://pkgpins.rpkg.dev, https://gitlab.com/salim_b/r/pkgs/pkgpins}, }

what: Facilitates Results Caching in R Packages Using the Pins Package
title: Facilitates Results Caching in R Packages Using the Pins Package
text: pkgpins builds upon pins package strives provide R package authors simple standardized way cache results filesystem suitable user directory.

title: Facilitates Results Caching in R Packages Using the Pins Package
text: TODO: describe design (separate user-cache pins board per pkg pkg version etc.)

title: Facilitates Results Caching in R Packages Using the Pins Package
text: two predefined parameter labels available pkgsnip fit typical use cases package. intended used @param roxygen2 tags1 follows: inline R code eventually result :
code: #' @param max_cache_age `r pkgsnip::param_label("max_cache_age")` #' @param use_cache `r pkgsnip::param_label("use_cache")` #' @param max_cache_age The duration after which cached results are refreshed (i.e. newly fetched). A valid [lubridate duration][lubridate::as.duration]. Use `Inf` to disable cache expiry. Only relevant if `use_cache = TRUE`. #' @param use_cache Return cached results if possible. If `FALSE`, results are always newly fetched regardless of `max_cache_age`.

title: Facilitates Results Caching in R Packages Using the Pins Package
text: install latest development version pkgpins, run following R:

title: Facilitates Results Caching in R Packages Using the Pins Package
text: (function) reference found .

title: Facilitates Results Caching in R Packages Using the Pins Package
text: package’s source code written R Markdown file format facilitate practices commonly referred literate programming. allows actual code freely mixed explanatory supplementary information expressive Markdown format instead rely # comments . .gen.R suffixed R source code found R/ generated respective R Markdown counterparts Rmd/ using pkgpurl::purl_rmd()2. Always make changes .Rmd files – never .R files – run pkgpurl::purl_rmd() regenerate R source files.

title: Facilitates Results Caching in R Packages Using the Pins Package
text: package borrows lot Tidyverse design philosophies. R code adheres principles specified Tidyverse Design Guide wherever possible formatted according Tidyverse Style Guide (TSG) following exceptions: Line width limited 160 characters, double limit proposed TSG (80 characters ridiculously little given today’s high-resolution wide screen monitors). Furthermore, preferred style breaking long lines differs. Instead wrapping directly expression’s opening bracket suggested TSG, prefer two fewer line breaks indent subsequent lines within expression opening bracket: results less vertical horizontal spread code better readability pipes. Usage magrittr’s compound assignment pipe-operator %<>% desirable3. Usage R’s right-hand assignment operator -> allowed4. R source code split several files suggested TSG instead (far possible) kept single file Rmd/pkgpins.Rmd well-structured thanks Markdown support. far possible, deviations TSG plus additional restrictions formally specified lintr configuration file .lintr, lintr can used right away check formatting issues:
code: # TSG proposes this do_something_very_complicated(   something = "that",   requires = many,   arguments = "some of which may be long" )  # we prefer this do_something_very_complicated(something = "that",                               requires = many,                               arguments = "some of which may be long") pkgpurl::lint_rmd()

title: Facilitates Results Caching in R Packages Using the Pins Package
text: R packages provide memoization infrastructure. Memoization suited best caching purely functional programming results, .e. caching functions always return result arguments (complete statelessness) – something ’s often case functions accessing external APIs. least two actively developed memoization packages: Tidyverse-style memoise package. R.cache package. R package storr acts simple object cacher supporting various storage back ends. Notable thor back end combines -memory-mapping via LMDB -disk caching.

what: Get a package's user-cache pins board — board
title: Get a package's user-cache pins board — board
text: Returns pkg's user-cache pins board. board automatically created already exist.

title: Get a package's user-cache pins board — board
Get a package's user-cache pins board — board
text: pkg Package name. character scalar. pkg_versioned Whether make board name dependent pkg's version number. FALSE, board agnostic pkg's version number. Otherwise, separate board created pkg version number (e.g. upgrade).

title: Get a package's user-cache pins board — board
text: user-cache pins board belonging pkg (version number pkg_versioned = TRUE). object class pins_board_folder.

what: Cache an object to a package's user-cache pins board — cache_obj
title: Cache an object to a package's user-cache pins board — cache_obj
text: Stores object pkg's user-cache pins board, .e. caches filesystem.

title: Cache an object to a package's user-cache pins board — cache_obj
Cache an object to a package's user-cache pins board — cache_obj
text: board Package's user-cache pins board. x Object cached. id Pin name uniquely identifying x pkg's user-cache pins board. character scalar safe use paths common file systems. Necessary retrieve x using get_obj(). already existing pin named id silently overwritten. qs_preset serialization algorithm preset use. See qs::qsave() (section Presets) details.

title: Cache an object to a package's user-cache pins board — cache_obj
text: x, invisibly.

title: Cache an object to a package's user-cache pins board — cache_obj
text: Note cache_obj() always overwrite already existing cached object id. See hash_fn_call() convenient way create id uniquely identifies function call. just use with_cache() internally relies former. Note reading cached result user-cache pins board (.e. filesystem) might produce noticeable delay depending size cached object. Therefore, recommended cache results take considerable amount time recompute. avoid overhead re-reading cached result accessing multiple times, can always assign R variable benefit direct storage memory.

title: Cache an object to a package's user-cache pins board — cache_obj
code: # if the fn below would be part of a real package, we could instead define `this_pkg` globally # using `this_pkg <- utils::packageName()`; instead, we now cache to pkgpins's cache (which # itself never uses the cache) board <- pkgpins::board(pkg = "pkgpins")  # let's define a fn that returns R pkg sys deps from cache pkg_sys_deps <- function(pkg,                          use_cache = TRUE,                          max_cache_age = "6h") {   fetch <- TRUE    if (use_cache) {     pin_name <- pkgpins::hash_fn_call(from_fn = "pkg_sys_deps",                                       pkg)     result <- pkgpins::get_obj(board = board,                                id = pin_name,                                max_age = max_cache_age)     fetch <- is.null(result)   }      if (fetch) {     result <-       jsonlite::fromJSON(txt = paste0("https://sysreqs.r-hub.io/pkg/", pkg),                          simplifyVector = FALSE) |>       purrr::list_flatten()   }     if (use_cache && fetch) {     pkgpins::cache_obj(board = board,                        x = result,                        id = pin_name)   }    result }  # now get the sys deps for git2r for the first time (populating the cache) pkg_sys_deps("git2r") #> $libgit2 #> $libgit2$sysreqs #> [1] "/libgit2/i" #>  #> $libgit2$platforms #> $libgit2$platforms$DEB #> [1] "libgit2-dev" #>  #> $libgit2$platforms$RPM #> [1] "libgit2-devel" #>  #> $libgit2$platforms$PKGBUILD #> [1] "libgit2" #>  #> $libgit2$platforms$`OSX/brew` #> [1] "libgit2" #>  #>  #>  #> $openssl #> $openssl$sysreqs #> [1] "OpenSSL" #>  #> $openssl$platforms #> $openssl$platforms$DEB #> [1] "libssl-dev" #>  #> $openssl$platforms$PKGBUILD #> [1] "openssl" #>  #> $openssl$platforms$`OSX/brew` #> [1] "openssl@1.1" #>  #> $openssl$platforms$RPM #> [1] "openssl-devel" #>  #>  #>  #> $zlib #> $zlib$sysreqs #> [1] "/\\bzlib\\b/i" #>  #> $zlib$platforms #> $zlib$platforms$DEB #> [1] "zlib1g-dev" #>  #> $zlib$platforms$`OSX/brew` #> [1] "zlib" #>  #> $zlib$platforms$PKGBUILD #> [1] "zlib" #>  #> $zlib$platforms$RPM #> [1] "zlib-devel" #>  #>  #>  #> $libssh2 #> $libssh2$sysreqs #> [1] "/libssh2/i" #>  #> $libssh2$platforms #> $libssh2$platforms$DEB #> [1] "libssh2-1-dev" #>  #> $libssh2$platforms$RPM #> [1] "libssh2-devel" #>  #> $libssh2$platforms$PKGBUILD #> [1] "libssh2" #>  #> $libssh2$platforms$`OSX/brew` #> [1] "libssh2" #>  #>  #>   if (FALSE) { # for the `max_cache_age` (we've set a default of 6h), the cached result will be returned # (as long as `use_cache = TRUE`): bench::mark("with cache" = pkg_sys_deps("git2r"),             "without cache" = pkg_sys_deps("git2r", use_cache = FALSE),             iterations = 10,             relative = TRUE)}  # purge cache from the above example pkgpins::purge_cache(board = board)

what: Clear a package's user-cache pins board — clear_cache
title: Clear a package's user-cache pins board — clear_cache
text: Deletes objects package's user-cache pins board exceed certain max_age. board pkg_versioned, additionally deletes user-cache pins boards belonging versions package currently installed one.

title: Clear a package's user-cache pins board — clear_cache
Clear a package's user-cache pins board — clear_cache
text: board Package's user-cache pins board. max_age Age cached objects deleted. valid lubridate duration. Defaults 1 day (24 hours).

title: Clear a package's user-cache pins board — clear_cache
text: board, invisibly.

title: Clear a package's user-cache pins board — clear_cache
text: function called package load/unload, example.

title: Clear a package's user-cache pins board — clear_cache
code: if (FALSE) { # delete all cached results that are older than 7 days at once on package load: .onLoad <- function(libname, pkgname) {   pkgpins::clear_cache(board = pkgpins::board(pkg = pkgname),                        max_age = "7 days") }}

title: Hash a function call — hash_fn_call
text: Creates string uniquely identifies function call function's name hash specified arguments.

title: Hash a function call — hash_fn_call
Hash a function call — hash_fn_call
text: from_fn Name function hash_fn_call() called. character scalar. ... Arguments from_fn called . arguments omitted taken account generating hash.

title: Hash a function call — hash_fn_call
text: character scalar.

title: Hash a function call — hash_fn_call
text: function evaluate arguments .... .e. function call mypkg::foo(= my_var) cached "foo-ff6a1ba723cae45aeee265a71493cecf" my_var's value 100, whereas become "foo-3f6860362d51e26829cc6f2f3b2968e9" my_var's value 101. See examples .

title: Hash a function call — hash_fn_call
code: foo <- function(a, b = "default") pkgpins::hash_fn_call("foo", a, b)  foo("bar") #> [1] "foo-782c297a474889e0e16c91d7218df53a" a <- "bar" foo(a) #> [1] "foo-782c297a474889e0e16c91d7218df53a" a <- "barbie" foo(a) #> [1] "foo-cfb2a469df5d0d7742cfd54f435a16f2" a |> foo() #> [1] "foo-cfb2a469df5d0d7742cfd54f435a16f2" a |> foo(b = "default") #> [1] "foo-cfb2a469df5d0d7742cfd54f435a16f2"  # you can also create a hash that is based on a subset of all function arguments foo <- function(a, b = "default") pkgpins::hash_fn_call("foo", b)  foo("bar") #> [1] "foo-70aa9861fd915a068381031ccbb9e55d" foo("barrr") #> [1] "foo-70aa9861fd915a068381031ccbb9e55d" foo(b = "bar") #> [1] "foo-3606446b81d5551067274d18bbff6700"

what: Cache the result of an expression — with_cache
title: Cache the result of an expression — with_cache
text: One-stop solution add caching R expression, example within function. See examples.

title: Cache the result of an expression — with_cache
code: with_cache(   expr,   pkg,   from_fn,   ...,   pkg_versioned = TRUE,   use_cache = TRUE,   max_cache_age = "1 day" )

title: Cache the result of an expression — with_cache
text: expr Expression cache. pkg Package name. character scalar. from_fn Name function expr cached , .e. name function with_cache() called . character scalar. ... Arguments received from_fn caching depend. fundamental determine whether expr already cached . arguments must specified unnamed (see examples). Dynamic dots supported. pkg_versioned Whether make caching dependent version number pkg. FALSE, caching agnostic pkg's version number. Otherwise, separate user-cache pins board created time pkg's version number changes (e.g. upgrade), ensuring never return cached results different (old) package version, irrespective max_cache_age. use_cache Return cached results possible. FALSE, results always newly fetched regardless max_cache_age. max_cache_age duration cached results refreshed (.e. newly fetched). valid lubridate duration. Use Inf disable cache expiry. relevant use_cache = TRUE.

title: Cache the result of an expression — with_cache
text: result evaluating expr, cache use_cache = TRUE cached result exists exceeded max_cache_age.

title: Cache the result of an expression — with_cache
text: expr evaluated environment with_cache() called . See hash_fn_call() details pin name constructed uniquely identifies expr pkg's user-cache pins board.

title: Cache the result of an expression — with_cache
code: # if the fn below would be part of a real package, we could instead define `this_pkg` globally # using `this_pkg <- utils::packageName()`; instead, we now cache to pkgpins's cache (which # itself never uses the cache) this_pkg <- "pkgpins"  # let's define a fn that returns R pkg sys deps from cache pkg_sys_deps <- function(pkg,                          use_cache = TRUE,                          max_cache_age = "6h") {   pkgpins::with_cache(     expr = purrr::list_flatten(jsonlite::fromJSON(txt = paste0("https://sysreqs.r-hub.io/pkg/",                                                                pkg),                                                   simplifyVector = FALSE)),     pkg = this_pkg,     from_fn = "pkg_sys_deps",     pkg,     use_cache = use_cache,     max_cache_age = max_cache_age   ) }  # now get the sys deps for git2r for the first time (populating the cache) pkg_sys_deps("git2r") #> $libgit2 #> $libgit2$sysreqs #> [1] "/libgit2/i" #>  #> $libgit2$platforms #> $libgit2$platforms$DEB #> [1] "libgit2-dev" #>  #> $libgit2$platforms$RPM #> [1] "libgit2-devel" #>  #> $libgit2$platforms$PKGBUILD #> [1] "libgit2" #>  #> $libgit2$platforms$`OSX/brew` #> [1] "libgit2" #>  #>  #>  #> $openssl #> $openssl$sysreqs #> [1] "OpenSSL" #>  #> $openssl$platforms #> $openssl$platforms$DEB #> [1] "libssl-dev" #>  #> $openssl$platforms$PKGBUILD #> [1] "openssl" #>  #> $openssl$platforms$`OSX/brew` #> [1] "openssl@1.1" #>  #> $openssl$platforms$RPM #> [1] "openssl-devel" #>  #>  #>  #> $zlib #> $zlib$sysreqs #> [1] "/\\bzlib\\b/i" #>  #> $zlib$platforms #> $zlib$platforms$DEB #> [1] "zlib1g-dev" #>  #> $zlib$platforms$`OSX/brew` #> [1] "zlib" #>  #> $zlib$platforms$PKGBUILD #> [1] "zlib" #>  #> $zlib$platforms$RPM #> [1] "zlib-devel" #>  #>  #>  #> $libssh2 #> $libssh2$sysreqs #> [1] "/libssh2/i" #>  #> $libssh2$platforms #> $libssh2$platforms$DEB #> [1] "libssh2-1-dev" #>  #> $libssh2$platforms$RPM #> [1] "libssh2-devel" #>  #> $libssh2$platforms$PKGBUILD #> [1] "libssh2" #>  #> $libssh2$platforms$`OSX/brew` #> [1] "libssh2" #>  #>  #>   if (FALSE) { # for the `max_cache_age` (we've set a default of 6h), the cached result will be returned # (as long as `use_cache = TRUE`): bench::mark("with cache" = pkg_sys_deps("git2r"),             "without cache" = pkg_sys_deps("git2r", use_cache = FALSE),             iterations = 10,             relative = TRUE)}  # purge cache from the above example pkgpins::board(pkg = "pkgpins") |> pkgpins::purge_cache()
